messages: f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:18): dammit, why did apple feel the need to create more proprietary attributes for autocapitalize and autocorrect?!

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:30): did printers get slower? i could have sworn that 20 years ago laserjets were printing at least as fast as the ones i'm seeing on HP's site today, and they warmed up faster at that.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:31): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: the high end probably hasn't gotten slower but a lower end got introduced and people started bying those
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:31): where do you find the high end?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:32): i can't even find a single 802.11x printer on HP's site
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:32): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: at Kinko's
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:32): (laserjet printer, that is)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:32): heh
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:32): i mean to buy :-)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:33): hmm. I don't know if HP has exited the high end market and left it to Xerox and Canon
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:33): (I don't know where to buy those)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:33): "First color page in less than 16 seconds" $3199.99
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:33): 16 seconds?!
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:34): (HP Color LaserJet 5550dn Printer )
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (10:34): is that including boot-time or so?
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (10:34): and 3200 for a printer is a lot
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:35): yes and yes
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:35): for $3199.99 i expect my printer to be printing before i ask it to
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (10:37): has a EUR 80 (or less, don't really remember) black/white-laserjet that he almost never  needs

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:38): I gave up on owning a printer. My old, affordable, inkjet printers kept drying out cause I don't print frequently enough, and when I do, I just do it at the office
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:39): yeah this isn't for me
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:39): i haven't printed in like a decade
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:41): what are the quality printer manufacturers these days? is HP still it?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:41): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, is it intended for personal use by whoever you're getting it for, or office use?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:41): what's the difference?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:42): different feature requirements
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (10:42): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, canon is also ok, not sure about laserjet
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:43): like, an office printer would probably need an ethernet connection and be optimised for network setup, whereas personal use might not need that
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (10:44): for network setup you could always buy one of those apple thingies
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (10:44): with a usb-in
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:44): the requirements are: high quality (laser jet), network printer using 802.11g or n, color, automatic double-sided printing, fast per page and fast from cold.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:44): and reliable.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:44): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00,  the Airport Extreme or possibly Airport Express
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:44): i'd rather it have built in networking
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:46): HP doesn't have a printer that meets those requirements.
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (10:46): i've no experience at all with such beasts
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:46): at least not according to their site.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:46): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, so just printing, and no need for scanner/copier/fax functions?
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (10:46): my printer is in the closet and I take it out every couple of months to print some stupid expense report
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:46): right
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:48): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, http://www.brother-usa.com/Printer/ModelDetail.aspx?ProductID=HL4070CDW
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:49): looks interesting
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:49): still 17 seconds for first print though
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (10:49): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: You should use a commercial printing service for that, and then charge it on expenses
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:50): yeah, still slow though
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:50): both starting up and printing
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:50): you consider 21ppm slow?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:51): that's 1 page every 3 seconds
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:52): that's not faster than 20 years ago
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (10:52): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c, I'll ask for your advice next time :)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:52): so yes, i consider that slow
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (10:52): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c, meanwhile, charset stats? :)
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:52): so how many pages per minute are you expecting?
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (10:52): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, is this how you remember 20 years ago?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (10:52): Does anybody give double-sided printing speeds?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:53): only has a printer for paper-based accounting use cases

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (10:54): presumes 21ppm is one-sided, because all printers he's seen do double-sided make the paper go backwards and forwards lots of times before popping out and it takes forever
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:54): though when it exists, it can occasionally be used for printing train tickets
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:55): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: yeah, agreed
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:55): http://www.office.xerox.com/printers/color-printers/phaser-7760/enus.html
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:56): 35ppm for colour
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:56): "First-page-out time as fast as 9 seconds for color"
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:57): Is that fast enough?
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (10:57): no wifi though
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:58): yeah, but I was only searching for speed to see if it was possible to find anything at all fast enough for 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:58): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: hmm, that's better than i've seen so far

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:59): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, "With print speeds of up to 35 pages per minute for colour and 45 ppm for black and white and a first-page-out time of nine seconds for colour, the Phaser is considered one of the fastest printers in its class. " -- http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-158653373.html
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:59): Maybe there is a limit to how fast you can physically pull paper through a printer without bad side effects
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:01): Anyway we had some Xerox phaser thing when I was doing my PhD and it seemed OK. It got used a lot and didn't break down often or anything
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:01): cool
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:02): good to know what the top of the line is, at least
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:02): Colour reprodution was pretty poor. Dunno how fast it was or anything
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:02): are there color lasers whose color reproduction doesn't suck?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:02): thought color lasers were for printing powerpoint slides
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:03): and ad bureaus and the like used slower and more expensive non-laser stuff
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:03): In this case they were for printing science papers where relative colour tends to be more important than absolute colour
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:03): s/they were/it was/
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:03): yeah if you want to do something where colour really matters, you do ink jets, i think
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:04): but then if i'm printing photos, i'm gonna be using a photo printing shop
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:04): are wax printers still on the market?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:05): is that "solid ink"?

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:05): 9we were very licky to have a good colour printer at all; it was only because my group had seperate funding from the rest of the department. The department colour laserjet _really_ sucked)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:05): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: could be. I don't know.
